unnormalised: ## Film Festivals: More Than Just Red Carpets and Paparazzi!
normalised: ## Film Festivals: More Than Just Red Carpets and Paparazzi!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered what goes on behind the glitz and glamour of a film festival? It's not *just* about celebrities striking poses and fancy dresses, although, let's be honest, that *is* a fun part of it!
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered what goes on behind the glitz and glamour of a film festival? It's not *just* about celebrities striking poses and fancy dresses, although, let's be honest, that *is* a fun part of it!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a melting pot for creativity. They're a platform for independent filmmakers, documentary makers, and even established studios to showcase their work to a wider audience. You get to see films you *won't* necessarily find at your local PVR, movies that push boundaries and tell stories from perspectives you might never have considered.

They're a platform for independent filmmakers, documentary makers, and even established studios to showcase their work to a wider audience. You get to see films you *won't* necessarily find at your local P V R, movies that push boundaries and tell stories from perspectives you might never have considered.

unnormalised: I remember catching this amazing documentary at the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI) back in 2018. It was about the struggles of farmers in Vidarbha. Talk about eye-opening! It completely changed my perspective. You just wouldn't get that kind of exposure seeing the usual Bollywood fare - though, hey, I love a good *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge* re-run as much as the next person!

unnormalised: It's not just about watching movies either. Many festivals host workshops, Q&A sessions with directors, and networking events. Aspiring filmmakers can learn from the best in the industry and even get their foot in the door. Imagine pitching your script to someone who's worked on a Rs. 100 crore blockbuster!

unnormalised: And don't think you need to travel to Cannes or Venice! India has some fantastic film festivals like the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, or the Kolkata International Film Festival. They're a great way to experience different cultures and perspectives without having to travel 5000 km.

unnormalised: So, next time a film festival rolls around in your city, consider checking it out. You might just discover your next favourite film… or even find a new career path! You might even rub shoulders with someone famous - who knows, maybe even get a selfie with Shah Rukh Khan! Okay, maybe that's a long shot, but you never know! It's worth checking out at least once.
